name: John J. Cardin's Contested Election. John J. Cardin's Appeal

judges: Before Sterrett, C. J., Green, McCollum, Mitchell and Dean, JJ.
parties: John J. Cardin’s Contested Election. John J. Cardin’s Appeal.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Chief Justice Sterrett,
This case involves the same question that has been considered and decided in opinion just filed at No. 544, January term, 1896, In re Contested Election of Martin J. Lawlor, ante, p. 566.
For reasons given in that case this decree is affirmed with costs to be paid by the appellant.
opinions.author: Mr. Chief Justice Sterrett,

attorneys: John F. Whalen and Wm. A. Marr, for appellant.
casebody.head_matter:
John J. Cardin’s Contested Election. John J. Cardin’s Appeal.
Argued Feb. 15, 1897.
Appeal, No. 541, Jan. T., 1896, by John J.-Cardin, from order of Q. S. Schuylkill Co., declaring election void.
Before Sterrett, C. J., Green, McCollum, Mitchell and Dean, JJ.
Affirmed.
John F. Whalen and Wm. A. Marr, for appellant.
A. W. Schalck, for appellee.
Feb. 21, 1897 :
